newsitem.title: USA: U.S. blue chips weak, tech stocks draw interest.
newsitem.headline: U.S. blue chips weak, tech stocks draw interest.

text.p: U.S. blue chip stocks were broadly weaker Monday as a bout of profit-taking ate into the stock market's recent gains, but the technology sector continued to draw buyers.
The Dow Jones Industrial Average was down 57 points to 7739, while the Nasdaq composite was up 1.90 at 1449.

Peter Coolidge, senior equity trader at Brean Murray Co, said Compaq Computer Corp's agreement to acquire Tandem Computers Inc in a stock swap valued at $3 billion had added life to technology stocks.
"The deal has provided some verification that these values (on technology stocks) are not exorbitant," he said.
Tandem was up 6-1/4 at 21-1/4 and Compaq was off 1-3/4 at 105-1/8.
Traders and analysts said the broader market needs to correct from its recent series of run-ups.
On the New York Stock Exchange, declining issues outnumbered advancing issues by a seven-to-five ratio.
Dow component Philip Morris Cos Inc fell 1-3/8 to 44-1/4 in active trade following news of the tobacco settlement.
